h3.a: School Enrichment From Home Resource Page

div.p:
School Enrichment at Home (and a story about COVID-19 for kids)
Dear parents and guardians, you recently received a letter that listed enrichment activities you and your child may do from home during the time of this crisis. Below are links to many of the activities provided by your child's teachers. Junior High/High School Students are directed to their GOOGLE CLASSROOM s for activities.
Google Classroom Help for Students . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about School Enrichment From Home Resource Page

div.p:
Check rSchool Calendar for activity changes and cancellations.
You can view the schedule for each extracurricular activity, as well as the school district (early dismissals, no school, etc.) by clicking on the following link: rSchool Activity Calendar

a.aria-label: Read more about rSchool Activity Calendar

div.p:
Coronavirus (COVID19) Information
Twin River Public Schools remains dedicated to the health and safety of students and staff, and will continue to respond to health concerns in a reasonable, responsible manner.
For information from the CDC, go to https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
Local Updates:
Additional information:
There are a number of great resources - all free - that you can . . .

For the 2019 accreditation external review at Twin River Public Schools, a Google website was created to contain all of the materials and artifacts used. That website can be found by clicking on this link . If you have any questions about the website or contents of it, please contact either Barb Kuntz or Julie Strain (CSIP co-chairs), or an administrator.

div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 16:56 pm CDT

td.span: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 48. South southeast wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 83. South wind around 5 mph becoming north in the afternoon.

A 40 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms after 2am. Increasing clouds, with a low around 56. East wind 5 to 10 mph becoming south southwest after midnight. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
